title: Signal Report — Holiday flagship retail windows
highlights: Design tests to detect a 15–25% parade-weekend foot-traffic uplift and measure conversion.
Move a portion of headline promos 2–3 weeks earlier and track weekly sell-through and promo ROI.
Book a parade-weekend timed product window or 7–14 day pop-up and capture mailing-list and cross-sell metrics.
executive_summary: Parade-weekend flagship activations are expected to produce a 15–25% foot-traffic uplift versus baseline on the event weekend (test target). Stepping headline promotions 2–3 weeks earlier and tracking weekly sell-through is projected to increase early-deal share by 10–15% versus last year; design A/B tests to detect that range and measure promo ROI. In the next 30 days merchandising, store operations and analytics must instrument weekly sell-through and conversion tracking, book the parade-weekend timed product window or short pop-up, and run the forward-shifted promo A/B so decisions at week six are evidence-based. [^1][^3]
top_operator_moves: Run an A/B: forward-shift one headline promo (2–3 weeks) versus original timing; instrument weekly sell-through, promo ROI and inventory DSI for 4–6 weeks.
Activate a parade-weekend flagship timed window with an exclusive SKU set; measure walk-ins, conversion rate and average ticket during the event.
Reserve a 7–14 day co-branded pop-up in a high-footfall neighborhood and test mailing-list capture, cross-sell lift and social-engagement signals.
